ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to write, speak, and understand basic Chinese in about 5 months which is insane.
I now have a firm grip on first year elementary Chinese.
Greatly improved Chinese language proficiency; pronunciation emphasized, but speaking also greatly improved. Learned grammatical structures, vocabulary.
I gained knowledge about beginner Chinese language and vocab. I developed my ability to speak in Chinese with the consistent oral presentations.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is very rigorous and fast paced. Even though it's very hard, there is a lot of support which is nice.

Strengths of this course include helpful homework and assignments and a community building environment. Weaknesses of the course include grading assignments very close to exams or even after, making it hard to study off of.
no weaknesses, very well planned out

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. The Chinese department is very involved and makes sure students have all the support needed to succeed even if the language is difficult.
If they were passionate about learning the language, then yes I would recommend it.
Yes I would. Learning a new language is always hard, but the Level 1 Chinese class is manageable while still challenging.
if you are interested in learning chinese, it is a very well planned course
